title.narrative: Volmoed Staff COVID-19 Funds to Raise 60% Pay

description.narrative: Volmoed Retreat Centre and the staff have been severely impacted by the total lockdown in South Africa, due to the COVID-19 virus. Bookings have had to be cancelled for the foreseeable future, resulting in an end to income to pay the staff for the next months. The staff have been shifted to 60% of their salaries until bookings return, which may not be until the end of 2020. These funds would enable Volmoed to support the staff during the next six months and in future emergencies and crises.

organisation.narrative: The Volmoed Trust (for Healing And Reconciliation In South Africa)

mailing-address.narrative: Volmoed Farm 11, Hemel en Aarde Road Hermanus 7200 South Africa

title.narrative: COVID-19: Feed families at-risk in Mexico

description.narrative: Your project will support 150 families, who were already fighting against poverty and hunger, to meet the essential needs of food and hygiene during the closure of COVID-19 and who are also starting to catch the virus and do not have money to pay medications or medical care. Crecemos will provide nutritious and balanced meals to families, as well as hygiene and protection kits (detergent, soap and masks), will help pay for medicines and medical care for people infected between May and October.

organisation.narrative: Crecemos-Desarrollo Integral de la Juventud Oaxaquena,A.C.

mailing-address.narrative: Monte Alban #307 Fracc. San Jose La Noria Oaxaca 68120 Mexico

description.narrative: Due to the worldwide emergency caused by Covid-19, indigenous communities have been very affected, for this reason ODIGUA Sembrando Esperanza NGO plans to bring hygiene and food kits for these families. In addition to training Q'eqchi 'families in issues of agroecology and food to contribute to better family nutrition and thus mitigate the effects caused by this crisis.

mailing-address.narrative: 3a. Avenida 6-43 zona 2, Barrio San Pablo, San Pedro Carcha San Pedro Carcha 16009 Guatemala

title.narrative: UNITED WE FEED MORE CHILDREN IN HONDURAS

description.narrative: UNITED we feed more children in Honduras affected by COVID - 19. This initiative seeks to bring food and hygiene products to 2,000 children and their families affected by the emergency of COVID -19 in Honduras. The preventive measure of absolute curfew has affected families who live thanks to the income they receive daily from activities linked to the informal economy.

mailing-address.narrative: Edificio Torre Alianza Blv. San Juan Bosco Tegucigalpa 11101 Honduras

title.narrative: Volmoed Retreat Centre Programs for Reconciliation

description.narrative: Volmoed is a retreat and conference centre in Hermanus, South Africa. The focus of its mission for the past 34 years is reconciliation, focused on racial reconciliation, and reconciliation within families or groups. Groups or individuals come for training programs, conferences on reconciliation, group learnings, wellness retreats, peace & to relax. Due to Covid-19, there are no visitors and no income. They are meanwhile raising funds to keep Volmoed going.

organisation.narrative: The Volmoed Trust (for Healing And Reconciliation In South Africa)

mailing-address.narrative: Volmoed Farm 11, Hemel en Aarde Road Hermanus 7200 South Africa

description.narrative: This project will addresses the needs of 200 people with disabilities from poor families during this difficult period of COVID-19 who living at GAIRO district within Morogoro region. Providing entrepreneurship straining, provision of health protective devices against diseases (like sanitizes, mask, soap, sunburn lotion and hats that will keep skin healthy and protective), providing information about precaution measures of COVID-19 in accessible formats (using sign language and Braille writings).

mailing-address.narrative: P.O.BOX.259 DODOMA 255 Tanzania, United Republic of

title.narrative: Support 500 women to access health care in Nigeria

description.narrative: Greater Hands Foundation intends to support 500 most vulnerable pregnant women and girls in Ikom Local government area (LGA) of Cross River State, Nigeria with basic health care social support services that encourages facility services uptake and improved mechanism to cope with covid-19 and post pandemic health challenges, also providing 300 young women and girls of reproductive age with sanitary pads, addressing gender gaps and engender improved health and well-being of the marginalised women.

mailing-address.narrative: No.22 Ediba Road, off Rigbu Amba Road by State Housing Estate Four Corners, Ikom, Cross River State Ikom 551001 Nigeria

title.narrative: 55 laptops for our underprivileged female students

description.narrative: Dar Moustaqbel, 'House of the Future', is our student house in Marrakech and hosts 55 girls from underprivileged families. We offer them the opportunity to attend university by offering a safe house where they can prosper. Especially for girls from poor families, it is not easy to start a study and enter the labour market. Being digitally connected is a necessity for our students, and therefore we need to invest in laptops, especially now during Covid-19.

mailing-address.narrative: Bloemgracht, 38 H Amsterdam 1015TK Netherlands

title.narrative: COVID19 Provision of essential livelihood products

description.narrative: Under the current circumstances and as result of the COVID-19 lockdown, the lowest strata of the society, comprising of daily wage workers, agricultural coolies, workers in brick kilns, stone quarries, construction workers, contract labourers, street vendors and persons involved in lorry trade have been the worst hit. These groups have lost the only source of their income and have no means to make both ends meet or provide food for their families.

mailing-address.narrative: NO: 6, 2ND STREET, SASIKUMAR NAGAR, KANNAMANGALAM KANNAMANGALAM, TAMILNADU 632311 India

description.narrative: At this moment, we have thousands of people in Brazil, without the possibility of having an income to guarantee their livelihood. It was thinking about them that we are again in the Campaign with the objective of raising funds, to buy basic food baskets, cooking gas, PPE items, snacks and other items that will be distributed to our beneficiaries and their families assisted by the Institution's Projects. We need you to keep saving lives. Come with us?

organisation.narrative: Associacao para Protecao das Criancas e Adolescentes - Cepac

mailing-address.narrative: Rua Matim Afonso de Souza, 72 - Parque Imperial Barueri 06462130 Brazil

description.narrative: This project will provide our "Stop COVID-19 Community KIT" to 103 rural artisans & their impoverished families (aprox. 750 people) in 5 remote villages in stunning but isolated Atauro Island, too far away for government support. With little information, no income (no tourists to buy their handicrafts) and no soap and masks the next 2 months will be critical to avoid the spreading of COVID-19 like wild fire. We provided initial support - but now they need AID for the next 2 months.

mailing-address.narrative: Rua de Lautem, 1, Farol Dili 0000 East Timor

title.narrative: Covid-19 Pandemic: Support 3000 IDPs in Kuchigoro

description.narrative: The project aims to improve the lives of about 3,000 internally displaced persons (IDPs) in Kuchigoro community, Abuja, Nigeria by donating relief materials such as food items and cloths to them. In addition, sinking of a borehole to provide portable water for proper sanitation and also sensitization of the IDPs about infectious diseases, especially during this covid-19 pandemic through the use of print media. The project has kicked off and need more fund for wider coverage.

mailing-address.narrative: N0 84 Yakubu Gowon crescent Asokoro Abuja Abuja, Federal Capital 900241 Nigeria

title.narrative: Help us keep wildlife forever wild

description.narrative: Nationwide lock-down, a shattered economy and an uncertain future- the coronavirus outbreak has brought the world to a halt. However, wild animals oblivious to lock-down or our funding challenges continue to venture into human habitations. Our teams are attending to constant wildlife displacement calls from our project sites. Moreover, orphaned individuals undergoing rehabilitation at our rescue centres require constant nurturing before they go back to the wild. We seek your help to continue.

mailing-address.narrative: F-13, Sector 8, Noida, Uttar Pradesh 201301 India

description.narrative: Our project aims to expand both our distribution of food supplies and our local production and donation of protective masks for the populations living in the Island province of Mindoro, in the Philippines. Up to now, our organization has been able to successfully deliver food supplies to around 700 families and protective masks to around 2500 beneficiaries, bringing relief to the many families in need.

mailing-address.narrative: via XX Settembre 24 Padova, Veneto 35122 Italy

title.narrative: COVID-19 Rural Food Relief - Cape Agulhas region

description.narrative: The COVID-19 lockdown in South Africa has left a large portion of our population without any means of income, very few have access to social grants and foreign nationals have no support from government institutions. The HeadStart Trust is supporting already established community initiatives in the Cape Agulhas region, through food relief. We need your help to continue a sustained supply of food to these initiatives and the communities they support.

mailing-address.narrative: 5th Floor, MacGregor Standford Kruger House Cnr. Buitengracht & Riebeek Street Cape Town 8001 South Africa

title.narrative: Emergency Supplies to Save Cameroon from COVID-19

description.narrative: As COVID-19 spreads quickly in Cameroon, many people in the country are constantly living in fear and insecurity. With suboptimal health care conditions, the country may soon face terrible consequences. Our project - Cameroon Unites Against COVID-19 Project - will mainly take place in rural and urban areas across Northwest Cameroon, distributing educational materials (flyers, posters, T-shirts, posters) as well as personal protective equipment (soap, hand sanitizer, cloth mask) to 1,000 people.

mailing-address.narrative: Manchock Street, Oku, PO Box 905 Bamenda, Northwest Cameroon Cameroon

title.narrative: Provide for Needs Created by COVID-19 in Africa

description.narrative: Our teams in Sierra Leone and Liberia are experiencing skyrocketing prices and high unemployment in the communities we serve. This project will allow us to educate the community on sanitation and distribute supplies such as face masks, disinfectant, rice, oil, and water to help them avoid contracting COVID-19 and move forward into new jobs.

mailing-address.narrative: 3406 N 65TH St Omaha, NE 68104 United States

title.narrative: Relief for 200 families affected by quarantine

description.narrative: Under conditions in which the world lives to fight against the Coronavirus pandemic, Yemen faces many problems caused by quarantine and the problems caused by the war, as most people live in poor financial conditions and depend on the daily wage to survive because of the war. During the quarantine, these people will be denied access to living expenses and will be deprived of food. The Kamaran Foundation will distribute food and hygiene items to affected families in Yemen.

organisation.narrative: Kamaran Foundation for Development and Humanitarian works

mailing-address.narrative: Attan hood Sana'a 1306 Yemen

title.narrative: COVID-19: Help us/help St Francis Hospice with PPE

description.narrative: Help St. Francis Hospice fund PPE to protect its patients, their families, staff and volunteers from the spread of COVID-19. Imagine a time when PPE is not in short supply, when patients can be with their relatives and when people will not spend the last days of their lives separated from their family. Donations will protect staff and support family members to be with their relatives at one of the most vulnerable and difficult times of their life Help fund PPE NOW!

mailing-address.narrative: Marygreen Manor Hotel London Road Brentwood CM14 4NR United Kingdom

title.narrative: Helping KMS through COVID-19 and Lockdown

description.narrative: With the COVID-19 pandemic impacting everyday life, we thank you for your continued support. Right now Kampala Music School (KMS) faces new challenges due to the impact of Lockdown and social distancing. The music school building is shut and we have had to take lessons online where possible. However, this is challenging due to network and technology challenges. Hence <10% of students are accessing lessons impacting greatly on our income and ability to pay staff and maintain KMS.

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 18 Kitante Close Kampala N/A Uganda

title.narrative: Around the World in 7 Days Against Covid-19

description.narrative: Around the world Rugby people on the Front Line: Fight Covid-19 : Feed those in need : Save Lives. We honour every one of them, and alongside rugby players in the Forces and Police, who lay down their lives for us every day, we will support them in a challenge to travel around the world in 7 days. Join us, support them, save lives. Travel any way you can (human powered only), log your miles, donate to the relief effort to feed children and save lives.

mailing-address.narrative: Chargrove House Shurdington Road Cheltenham, Gloucestershire GL51 4GA United Kingdom

title.narrative: Offer A Meal In This Pandemic

description.narrative: In our community many children have been traumatized by the loss of their parents, abandoned due to extreme poverty . Mentor Orphans Africa provides shelters, food , Free Education and Healthy care to these vulnerable , orphaned children, Among these are HIV/ AIDS victims. due to the covid-19 pandemic, we cannot give basic needs due to situation changes in our country of limited movement, doubled prices.Apparently, our children feed on porridge for both breakfast and supper.

mailing-address.narrative: Wakiso Nansana kabumbi Kampala, A 26846 Uganda

description.narrative: With the COVID-19 pandemic impacting communities around the world-including ours-Project Promise's mission of improving the lives of at-risk youth on St. Croix is even more important than before. Your donation to this fund will support immediate and long-term relief and recovery in our vulnerable community during this challenging time.

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 875 Christiansted, VI 00821 United States

title.narrative: Donate Face Masks And Food To 200,000 Children

description.narrative: We want to help keep people and children safe from Covid-19 by sharing soaps, toiletries, face masks and even clean water. Save & Nurture Child Care Foundation (SNCC) has a responsibility to the community and children to keep them save from abuse and diseases, including opening projects in communities as they become pandemic hotspots. Our COVID-19 response focuses on three main priorities: supporting authorities to provide care for COVID-19 patients; protecting children who are at risk

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 2048, Michael Okpara, Akintola Williams House, Zone 7, Fct 970001 Nigeria

title.narrative: FOOD RELIEF COMMUNITY OUTREACH INTO ZANDSPRUIT

description.narrative: We are raising funds to support the poor during South Africa's Lockdown and COVID-19 crisis, in our nearby township called Zandspruit, which is home to thousands of poor people with most living in shacks and little access to basic needs. Through our partnerships and community relationships we are aiming to help families with nutritional basic food supplies, basic hygiene and cleaning products. We need all the help we can get for our poor. Thank you in advance for your generosity and support.

mailing-address.narrative: Unit B3, Ateljee Street Randpark Ridge Johannesburg 2195 South Africa

title.narrative: Water & hygiene kits to fight COVID-19 in Cameroon

description.narrative: The orphanages in Cameroon have no way of preventing the spread of the virus, and many of the children don't even have access to drinking water. LifeTime Projects has therefore decided to act urgently to disinfect the orphanages, hand out hygiene kits to 200 children and drill a water well in one of the homes that currently doesn't have access to drinking water. An awareness campaign is being launched to inform the children and neighboring population on how to stop the spread of COVID-19

mailing-address.narrative: 9 rue de Neuchatel Strasbourg 67000 France

description.narrative: The 100s programmatic cornerstones are Mentoring, Education, Economic Empowerment, & Health and Wellness. Our COVID-19 relief efforts bridge the digital divide by ensuring disadvantaged students have (1) appropriate electronic equipment & Wi-Fi access to complete their schoolwork, (2) participate in virtual mentoring sessions & other educational enrichment, (3) provide masks for mentees, (4) host virtual town halls, & (5) provide parents who are essential workers with gift cards for necessities.

mailing-address.narrative: 141 Auburn Avenue, NE Atlanta, GA 30303 United States

title.narrative: Fighting COVID-19 In Haiti 4 Community Justice!

description.narrative: The Grand'Anse Region is key to Haiti's food security. The 1st phase of our COVID-19 Campaign focuses on 19 villages that are most vulnerable & the lives & health of 12,600 families-about 40,000 people who, as farming families, are essential & indispensable to Haiti's economy. Haiti's Challenges: A high rate of infection 8.2% ; A dysfunctional health care system. Our 1st focus: Prevention. Our Strategy: Outreach to communities & providing residents with hygiene kits & information.

organisation.narrative: Economic Stimulus Projects for Work and Action- ESPWA

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 391494 Cambridge, MA 02139 United States

title.narrative: COVID-19 Response for Older People in Rural India

description.narrative: In India, people in rural areas are not being reached with supplies and services to stop the second wave of COVID-19. HelpAge is responding in remote areas of the country by setting up a dedicated COVID-19 ward and ambulance service at a rural hospital in Rajasthan's Thar Desert region. We are supporting efforts to reach out to 200,000 older people in the Thar Desert region of Rajasthan. We are additionally distributing critical health information on COVID-19, along with urgently needed hygiene

mailing-address.narrative: 1730 M St. Nw Suite 1000 Washington, DC 20036 United States

title.narrative: Act to prevent coronavirus' spread in East Africa

description.narrative: People across East Africa are on the front line of the coronavirus pandemic. Communities hampered by under-resourced healthcare systems, poor infrastructure and insecure livelihoods are struggling to prevent the spread of this disease and protect lives. Tens of thousands of people are faced with risks posed by a lack of access to health facilities combined with difficulty in securing adequate food, shelter and clean water. Health Poverty Action is working in these communities to safeguard lives.

mailing-address.narrative: 31-33 Bondway London SW8 1SJ United Kingdom

description.narrative: The entire world is currently battling the COVID-19 pandemic and Nigeria is not exempted from this battle. For a country designated the poverty capital of the world, many Nigerians are finding it extremely difficult to survive this period with many flouting physical distancing and other preventive measures in the scramble for survival. Obijackson Foundation with your kind support aims to provide food and medical supplies to 500 rural impoverished Nigerians and 500 front-line medical workers

mailing-address.narrative: 2 Madonna drive Okija 431121 Nigeria

title.narrative: 50000 Masks for Vulnerable Communities in COVID-19

description.narrative: This project will support the production of FDA-approved protective masks, produced by Protec, our social enterprise in Vietnam that employs individuals with disabilities, to address the continuous need for personal protective equipment in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. The masks will be distributed to help vulnerable communities that are heavily impacted by the pandemic in Asia and other parts of the world.

mailing-address.narrative: 74 Mac Dinh Chi Street, District 1 Ho Chi Minh City, District 1 70000 Vietnam

title.narrative: Stay Home Food Support for 1,000 Single Mothers

description.narrative: It is undouble that COVID-19 has hit hard on not just the health sector, but every facet of society. In Sierra Leone, Socio-economic state of women with disabilities who are mainly single mothers is appalling. In these difficult times when lockdowns and stay home measures are instituted, women with disabilities suffered with starvation, with barely little or nothing to eat with their children. Donating to a fund that will provide food for these hungry single disable mothers will save lives.

organisation.narrative: Network Forum for Women with Disability

mailing-address.narrative: Horticulture building, New England Ville Freetown 00232 Sierra Leone

title.narrative: Act to limit coronavirus' spread in Southeast Asia

description.narrative: People across Southeast Asia are on the front line of the coronavirus pandemic. Communities hampered by under-resourced healthcare systems, poor infrastructure and insecure livelihoods are striving to prevent the spread of this disease and protect lives. Thousands of people living in border regions are faced with the risks posed by widespread migratory working combined with a lack of access to health facilities. Health Poverty Action is working in these communities to safeguard lives.

mailing-address.narrative: 31-33 Bondway London SW8 1SJ United Kingdom

description.narrative: Our plan is simple: educate and equip to slow the spread. The C2C Collaborative: COVID-19 Response will secure emergency items and provide funds for our two Peasant Associations to purchase items on the ground. These items will be used to create 1,000 response packets and training materials.

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 470218 Brooklyn, NY 11247 United States

title.narrative: Intervention and Response Under COVID-19 Pandemic

description.narrative: The project addresses the newly developing vulnerability of 120 poor children and families due to COVID-19 in poor communities of Addis Ababa. It includes children's educational and psycho-emotional needs while staying at home. Poor communities lack access to basic protective material. Hence, the project intends to solve the problem by distributing food items, protective materials, sanitizer, soap, provide home-based educational assistance, along with psycho-emotional and counseling services.

mailing-address.narrative: Addis Ababa, Gulele Sub City Addis Ababa 32321 Ethiopia

title.narrative: Support 105 children with special needs in Uganda

description.narrative: Children with special needs especially those suffering from cerebral palsy, Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) and other physical and mental handicaps need to be supported in order to reach their potential and that is what Lala's Children Support Organisation has been doing for some time now. We have seen several children's ways of living improved. More than ever, we need your urgent assistance in continuing to help these children especially through the post covid 19 era.

mailing-address.narrative: Lalas Near Doctor's Hospital Seguku,Entebbe Road Lala's Day Care Seguku,Plot No.224 Kampala 256 Uganda

title.narrative: The Actors Fund COVID-19 Emergency Assistance

description.narrative: This program supports services for performing arts and entertainment professionals experiencing emergency due to COVID-19. The Actors Fund, a national human services organization headquartered in NYC, serves everyone in film, theater, television, music, opera, radio, and dance: through financial assistance grants, health insurance enrollment, affordable housing resources, financial wellness workshops, career counseling, and support groups for injured dancers, seniors, and addiction/recovery.

mailing-address.narrative: 729 Seventh Avenue 10th Floor New York, NY 10019 United States

title.narrative: Teach agriculture to youth in Puerto Rico

description.narrative: Hurricane Maria left us without food supplies; and together with recent earthquakes, and COVID-19 food imported to the Island has increased to 90%. The Pitirre Agri-Educational Project will contribute to the Island's food security and will provide didactic and hands-on experiences in agriculture to 30 at-risk and very low-income youth living in the western area of the Island.

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 29132 San Juan 00929-0132 Puerto Rico

title.narrative: Emergency respond to COVID-19 (Le Tonle Training)

description.narrative: Le Tonle Training Guesthouse and Restaurant aims to provide free theoretical and practical training for tourism and hospitality jobs to young, disadvantaged Cambodians. Training includes receptionist duties, housekeeping, cooking and hospitality. Provision of these skill-sets enables vulnerable youth to access varied and worthwhile career opportunities. In turn, graduated trainees and are able to live independently and support their family by sending some of their earnings back home.

mailing-address.narrative: Street 3, Chreom Village Kratie Town, Kratie Province 00000 Cambodia

title.narrative: COVID-19 Food Relief for Refugees in Myanmar

description.narrative: This food relief project supports 200 refugee families in need living in Karen State of the Thai-Myanmar border. After many years of living in foreign soil as refugees, they resettled in Karen State to begin their life as residents, but COVID-19 has made them more marginalized and difficult to get out from poverty. GCS will implement emergent relief to provide rice to the most vulnerable refugee families. On World Refugee Day, 20 June, we hope that you remember and support them.

mailing-address.narrative: #901 Gardentower, 84 Youlgok-ro, Jongno-gu, Seoul, Korea Seoul, Jongno 03131 South Korea

title.narrative: Covid19:Relief for Vulnerable Communities in India

description.narrative: Covid-19 has disproportionately affected marginalized communities in India with the loss of livelihoods, lack of food, poor awareness and access to health facilities as well as other basic needs. Educate Girls has identified 1,517 villages in rural India that are in dire need of support through a data-backed approach and is working with the local administration to support the relief efforts to distribute ration kits to underprivileged families through its network of 14,000 community volunteers.

mailing-address.narrative: 201- Durolite House, Above Renault Showroom, Opp. Citi Mall New Link Road, Andheri (West) Mumbai, Maharashtra 400053 India

title.narrative: COVID-19 and Community family mental health

description.narrative: This project will conduct community family mental health awareness promotion, we are planning 20 mobile community outreach activities to raise awareness in Mashonaland east province in Zimbabwe .Establishment of a toll-free line in Zimbabwe for tele-therapy providing mental health support for people directly and indirectly affected by COVID-19.

organisation.narrative: Society for Pre and Post Natal Services (SPANS)

title.narrative: COVID-19 Poverty & Food Relief by ARTI

description.narrative: Novel corona -19 pandemic create an unusual circumstance in the world history.` The WHO has declared the corona virus epidemic as a GLOBAL HEALTH EMERGENCY- INDIA declared lockdowns and still continues to fight against covid -19. TIRUVINNAMALAI district in affected very high (RED ZONE) and increase the new infection cases still now. ARTI- take to strive against corona in 25 villages and request our donors to your donation to this fund will help stop spread and protect us all peoples.

organisation.narrative: ASSOCIATION FOR RURAL AND TRIBAL IMPROVEMENT

mailing-address.narrative: 399. Padagam village@post, Kalasapakkam Taluk, Tiruvannamalai Dist, Tiruvannamalai 606904 India

title.narrative: COVID-19 relief: Food and Essentials for the poor

description.narrative: India's nation-wide lockdown for curbing COVID-19 has hurt the daily wage earners and poor underprivileged families severely. They have lost their income. Poverty having prevented them from saving any money, they are now unable to buy food. They are starving. This project will help families in the State of West Bengal. Food and essentials kits - with rice, pulses, potatoes, oil, salt, biscuits, masks and soaps - will provide them with sustenance and safety while ensuring their survival.

mailing-address.narrative: 63 Chowringhee Road 33 Alexandra Court Kolkata, West Bengal 700020 India

title.narrative: Action for Education: Back to School

description.narrative: In March, the threat of Covid-19 forced our education centres on the Aegean islands to close. Since then, asylum seekers have faced months of isolation and congestion in overcrowded camps. Now, as lockdown measures are slowly lifted, we're getting ready to get back to school.

mailing-address.narrative: Ekatis 4 Chios 82100 Greece

title.narrative: Save 500 Vulnerable Families in Nigeria COVID-19

description.narrative: This project is designed to provide foodstuffs to 500 vulnerable households in Ohaji/Egbema, Imo State of Nigeria. Ohaji/Egbema is a densely populated Local Government in Imo State with the majority of the people living in extreme poverty and and the impact of hunger has pushed many of the youths in the area indulge themselves in cultism and crime. The project will help to reduce hunger and cultism in the area. Awarra Court Area is an area that has been seriously affected during this COVID-19.

organisation.narrative: Foundation for Social-Economic Development of African Communities for Peaceful Co-Existence

title.narrative: Promote 100 Agric-Chain Jobs for Jobless Nigerian

description.narrative: This project initiative will support 100 Agricultural Value Chain Enterprises jobs for Nigerian youth among teaming unemployed graduates and open more doors to food production, alleviating poverty and reducing the post economic negative effects of COVID-19 pandemic .

description.narrative: This project will build stronger response capacities of older persons through RECEWAPEC Eye-care Center in Bambui, Cameroon so that we are all better equipped to face the COVID-19 pandemic.

organisation.narrative: The Regional Center for the welfare of ageing person in Cameroon(RECEWAPEC)

mailing-address.narrative: P.o Box 5198 Bamenda +237 Cameroon

description.narrative: Do you know that 7 in 10 children do not complete primary school in Malawi? To change this, CharChar delivers an accelerated Literacy Programme, helping to reduce high drop-out rates in Primary School and providing a sustainable route out of poverty through education. With your help we will be able to expand our volunteer literacy teacher corps to reach over 6,000 underprivileged primary school-age children in Malawi and reverse the negative impacts of COVID-19. Education cannot wait!

mailing-address.narrative: Flat 15, Evesham House Hereford Road London W2 4PD United Kingdom

title.narrative: Protecting 3000 people from Covid-19 in Yemen

description.narrative: The project aims to provide food for 3,000 members of the poor Yemeni families headed by people suffering from chronic diseases or the elderly in Al-Sunainah area in Sanaa, because they are threatened with death as a result of Covid-19, as well as providing hygiene soap and face masks, and educating these families about the risk of the epidemic and how to prevent it.

title.narrative: Plying Health Services to 120 Under Tent Children

description.narrative: By providing healthcare awareness and services to the under tent children, we will save them from the die of several sicknesses. Mostly, the Coronavirus that is spreading rapidly in Afghanistan we need to follow and obtain the cautions against the pandemic virus. It is obvious that observing personal cleanliness is very important for affecting the prevention, so, unfortunately, the under tent children don't have access to healthcare awareness and service.

mailing-address.narrative: Darulaman Street Kabul 25000 Afghanistan

description.narrative: SHAKHI 'Friends of Women' is a grassroots feminist organization working with marginalized women. Pregnant women and newborn children get nutrition food, medicines, and essential supplies during the COVID-19 pandemic. Your donation to this fund will support immediate and long-term relief and recovery in vulnerable communities especially pregnant mothers and newborn children during one of the most challenging times we are collectively facing.

mailing-address.narrative: Pheta Rural Municipality, Ward No 1 Bhaluhi Bhaluhi 44400 Nepal

description.narrative: Cosma seeks funding to establish and maintain a community fund in the Masaka sub-region of Uganda to re-capitalize existing farmer cooperatives which have faced an unexpected financial crisis due COVID 19. These member cooperatives will be able to borrow money from the community fund to help individual member farmers overcome socio-economic hardship arising from the COVID 19 lock down.

title.narrative: COVID-19 Expansion of existing ventilator capacity

description.narrative: In the framework of the COVID-19 pandemic in Argentina, the forecasts of infected people at the peak of contagion that will require connection to ventilators by far exceeds the current available capacity. This project proposes the development of a low complexity kit that allows quadrupling the capacity of each ventilator in a context of peak demand and saturation of the available ones. This kit may be manufactured locally in each country.

organisation.narrative: Asociacion Civil Ingenieria sin Fronteras Argentina

mailing-address.narrative: Medrano 1622 5 Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires C1425GDB Argentina

title.narrative: SUPPORT FUND TO REDUCE SPREAD OF COVID-19 NIGERIA

description.narrative: COVID-19 pandemic is threatening everyone's way of life worldwide, but for those living in poverty, the potential impact is massive. Your donation to this fund will help stop COVID-19 spread and help to provide - face mask, hand-sanitizer, soap + handwashing buckets with tap and food parcels to help 1000 vulnerable families in Nigeria to survive, during one of the most challenging time we have collectively faced.

mailing-address.narrative: Ibenabor Village, Oraukwu, Idemili North Local Government Area Onitsha 420001 Nigeria

title.narrative: Help Women Flee Domestic Violence During COVID-19

description.narrative: This project will assist women and their children left without a means to navigate through the system of domestic abuse outside of a shelter environment. Victims receive free domestic violence counseling, therapy, case management, safety plans, support groups, protective orders, crime victims' compensation applications, and shelter placement if needed. As the foundation that bridges the steps between not needing a shelter and not being able to afford the private counseling needed to help heal.

organisation.narrative: Fresh Spirit Wellness for Women Inc.

mailing-address.narrative: 5100 Westheimer Rd Ste 200 Houston, TX 77056 United States

description.narrative: This scale up project proposal aims at mitigating gender based violence injustice in South Sudan. its noted that GBV escalates during crisis, as the world faces COVID-19 pandemic, intimate partner violence among other vices perpetrated against women and girls are on the rise. Save a Life International intends to construct 3 safe houses with a capacity of 600 women, girls and the disabled. We will as well train men, women and local authorities to be awareness ambassadors against GBV vices.

mailing-address.narrative: 21st street 23rd avenue Juba Juba 211 South Sudan

title.narrative: Rapid support of 90 small young Farmers in Rwanda

description.narrative: This project aim is to support local young farmers affected by COVID-19 and fight stunting of children living in Community in Ruhango District. This project will support 60 youth who are in agribusiness of horticulture and 30 who are in livestock of poultry farming in southern province of Rwanda in Ruhango District shocked by the Pandemic of COVID-19 .RODI will provide Technical assistance ,Coaching, some materials , demonstration plots and distribution of layer Chickens and Cows .

mailing-address.narrative: Kicukiro District Diamond House 2nd Floor Kigali, Rwanda - Rwanda

title.narrative: Build 10 wells for schools and villages in uganda

description.narrative: Buhaguzi Action For Rural Development Foundation(BUARDEFO ) is to build 10 wells to support 08 schools and 02 villages of Kikuube district western Uganda with safe and clean water. This will help promote sanitation preventing the spread of water born diseases, covid 19, promoting formal education and economic development in homes. The wells will be excavated manually hitting the water table. A manual hand pump shall be installed on each well. The project is anticipated to last 18 months .

organisation.narrative: Buhaguzi Action For rural Development foundation(Buardefo)

mailing-address.narrative: Buhimba Hoima Kampala, Kikuube +256 Uganda

title.narrative: COVID Emergency Hunger Relief for the Homeless

description.narrative: This project will provide hot meals to Homeless persons living on the elevated roadside platforms in Tamil Nadu, India. COVID-19 lockdown has severely impacted the lives of the Homeless who have no options to work and earn. They cannot even beg as none is seen on the road who can give them money or food.No restaurants, temples, and community kitchens are open to give them food or shelter. Your donations will help them have one freshly cooked hot meals a day!

organisation.narrative: Institute for Education, Research, and Scholarships

mailing-address.narrative: 800 Wilshire Boulevard Suite 200 Los Angeles, CA 90017 United States

title.narrative: Drinking Water to Navajo Nation Covid-19 Relief

description.narrative: In response to overwhelming need for drinking water throughout Navajo Nation, Can'd Aid is working to fulfill truckloads of water to the area as quickly as possible. The next shipment will be distributed to the White Mountain Apache Tribe in Whiteriver, Arizona. Within the White Mountain Apache Tribe includes a small community, Seven Mile, where currently COVID-19 cases have spiked to over 200 in the last week. Several other communities are in need as the summer temperatures rise.

mailing-address.narrative: 20 Bowen St. Longmont, CO 80501 United States

title.narrative: Rosa's Covid-19 Fund for the UK Women's Sector

description.narrative: Rosa is a grantmaking charity that funds women's organisations across the UK. We have launched a response fund to provide grants to small, specialist women's organisations affected by the impact of Covid-19. Grants of up to 10,000 will help these organisations to deliver their vital services at this critical time of increased need. Those services include refuges for victims of domestic abuse, legal advice lines, maternity rights campaigns, specialist support for marginalised women, and more.

mailing-address.narrative: 4th Floor, United House North Road London N7 9DP United Kingdom

description.narrative: Right now, preventing exploitation means making sure there is food accessible for vulnerable families experiencing food insecurity due to COVID-19. $90 provides one family living in the East Java Cemetery with a care package of food and basic necessities for one month.

mailing-address.narrative: 16055 SW Walker Rd, PMB 239 Beaverton, OR 97006 United States

title.narrative: Online English For Children Quarantined by Covid19

description.narrative: Due to the Covid-19 virus outbreak, many students are unable to return to their regular schools. To respond to this situation, Stepping Stones is now training volunteers to teach children who are under home-quarantine.

organisation.narrative: Shanghai Minhang Qu Hua Cao Pu Lu Shi Qing Shao Nian Fa Zhan Zhong Xin

mailing-address.narrative: 2nd Floor, No. 75, Le Shan Road, Xuhui District Shanghai, Shanghai 200030 China

description.narrative: We put the purchased food (including rice, oil, grains and other basic foods) and the surplus food that we rescued (such as milk powder, etc.) into a beautiful food package, a total of 2500 copies, and gave them to the urban communities and the poor families in poor mountains Some of these families have fallen into poverty due to serious illness and disability and lost their main labor force, and some have sudden family accidents or have difficulties because of COVID-19 unemployment.

organisation.narrative: Shanghai Oasis Public Service Development Center

mailing-address.narrative: Eshan Road No.633 C-112, PuDong District, ShangHai Shanghai 200127 China

title.narrative: Footprints 4 Sam Super Sam Hero Vehicle Project

description.narrative: Footprints 4 Sam offers hope & dignity to underprivileged children with chronic illness. Our vehicle initiative launched in 2018 helps children with chronic illness to more readily access clinic & hospital appointments in Cape Town, South Africa. We have transported over 2700 children (Over 5200 passengers including caregivers & siblings). During Covid_19 we have delivered medication, food and toiletries to these families. We would like to expand this programme and ensure its sustainability.

mailing-address.narrative: 12 Sparrow Drive, Magaliessig, 2067, Gauteng, South Africa Gauteng 2067 South Africa

description.narrative: As the coronavirus continues to spread, its devastating effects are being felt around the world including in our community in rural Nicaragua. Waves of Hope, is excited to be teaming up with our friends at Rise Up Kids with the common goal of making sure that people are nourished and looked after during this challenging time. Together we share the common goal of making sure that families have access to food, clean water, healthcare, emergency supplies and other essential items.

mailing-address.narrative: 2322 Fleet Path Court Burlington, ON L7P 4B7 Canada

title.narrative: Emergency Relief Packs for 700 Families in Armenia

description.narrative: The situation related with the spread of COVID-19 has a drastic effect especially on the lives of the children and families living in extreme poverty.We have selected 700 extremely poor families in Armenia where the need is especially severe. As a result, these 700 families will be secured with food and hygiene packages. They urgently need support from all of us. We are now working to support these families, but our resources are limited and we need YOUR support to be able to serve all of them.

organisation.narrative: World Vision Armenia Child Protection Foundation

mailing-address.narrative: 1 Romanos Melikyan Street, Yerevan, Armenia Yerevan 0065 Armenia

title.narrative: Improving nutrition needs for 250 HIV+ children.

description.narrative: The lockdown as a result of COVID 19 in Uganda, has left HIV+ children gravely affected by lack of basic needs such as food, thus compromising the effectiveness of their treatment. Lack of proper nutrition, has left many starving, hardly having a meal a day. This exposes them to treatment failure and increased viral load which may see more deaths even after the pandemic. Project aims at saving life for 250 HIV+ children by providing food nutritious porridge, milk etc in Mityana Districts.

mailing-address.narrative: P.O Box 289, Kitinkokola, Ttamu Division, Mityana Muncipality, Mityana District Mityana Municipality Kampala +256 Uganda

title.narrative: Help 350 families grow food to overcome COVID-19

description.narrative: If you cannot work or lose your job due to the crisis, how do you feed your family? Let's provide 350 families with the knowledge and tools to grow their own food! We plan to co-design and build 20 urban food gardens with local communities whose income have been severely affected by COVID-19 and are struggling to feed their families. The families will also receive training so that they can use these gardens sustainably to provide food for their families now and be more resilient in the future.

mailing-address.narrative: Santa Julia 514 Nunoa Santiago de Chile 7760267 Chile

title.narrative: Help Protect Families from Disease with Safe Water

description.narrative: Now more than ever, access to safe water is critical to the health of our world. The spread of the novel coronavirus has highlighted the power of safe, reliable water in protecting communities and saving lives. This project will provide 500 families in Ghana with a month supply of clean water during these challenging times and help protect them from disease.

mailing-address.narrative: 122 East 42nd Street 28th Floor New York, NY 10168 United States

description.narrative: The COVID 19 Sanitary Pack Drive will support 500 vulnerable girls in Kilifi County, Kenya to help them manage their menstrual health hygienically and in a more dignified way. These girls are currently experiencing difficult times in regard to their menstrual health since most of the places they depended on for the free supply of pads have been closed indefinitely due to the COVID19 pandemic. This project will provide them with a sanitary package; sanitary towels, pants, and bathing soap.

mailing-address.narrative: Mnarani Kilifi Kenya Kilifi 80108 Kenya

title.narrative: Health & Education rights for all in South Africa

description.narrative: SECTION27 believes in the power of the country's Constitution and is committed to helping realize it. We have led the fight for health and education rights for the past ten years and continue to do so through monitoring, advocacy, and litigation during the COVID-19 pandemic. With your support, our able team will be able to continue our work on sexual and reproductive health rights, school safety, universal health care, education for children with disabilities, and mental health during Covid-19.

organisation.narrative: Section27, Incorporating The AIDS LAW PROJECT NPC

mailing-address.narrative: 1st floor, South Point corner, 87 De Korte street, Braamfontein Johannesburg 2017 South Africa

title.narrative: Relief Packages for Transgender Youth in Pakistan

description.narrative: We will distribute relief packages to 250 HIV-positive Transgender youth in Multan who are in urgent need of these items. Relief packages include COVID-19 prevention items - surgical masks (10), hand sanitizer (2), gloves (10), tissue pack (1), soap (5) - and food - rice (3 kg), wheat flour (5 kg), sugar (2 kg), tea (1 kg), nutritional supplement powdered milk (400 gm), chickpeas (1 kg), split green gram (500 gm), split red lentil (500 gm), dates (200 gm), oil pouch (2 liter), salt (8 gm).

mailing-address.narrative: 1110 Vermont Ave NW Suite 500 Washington, District of Columbia 20005 United States

title.narrative: Adopt a Coral Nursery, Empower a Local Community

description.narrative: Ecologically-based tourism and alternative livelihood program for the local fisher folk, surf instructors and tourism community, who have been out of jobs since the nationwide Covid-19 lockdown in the Philippines. Managed in collaboration with FEED technical partner Ocean Quest Global, Coral Propagation Certified members of Jongky Surf School, and with coral nursery support from 45 trained members of the local La Union Surf Club, Inc. (LUSC) - oldest surf association in the Philippines.

organisation.narrative: Fostering Education and Environment for Development, Inc.

mailing-address.narrative: 23C Pacific Plaza, Ayala Avenue Makati, NCR 1222 Philippines

title.narrative: Emergency COVID-19 Relief in the Maasai Mara

description.narrative: The Maasai community along the edge of the Maasai Mara National Reserve is suffering from an acute collapse of food and health security in the wake of COVID-19. This project will purchase and deliver food and other life-saving provisions to over 300 rural families in extreme need in the Maasai Mara. It will also provide sanitary supplies to girls, deliver school materials, and provide much-needed education on containing the virus. The project will make a tangible impact on 5000 people.

mailing-address.narrative: 4142 Baker Ave Palo Alto, CA 94306-3907 United States

title.narrative: Give COVID-19 Front Liners access to rural Ghana.

description.narrative: Cocoa360 is leading Ghana's rural response to COVID-19. We're piloting a two-phased COVID preparedness and prevention plan dubbed CoCoPOPP, which will focus heavily on Public Health prevention and control measures in Tarkwa Breman and its 7 surrounding villages.

mailing-address.narrative: 228 S. 40th Street Philadelphia, PA 19104 United States

description.narrative: This project will help feed the 106 horses that live at Horses of Tir Na Nog for one month. Each June we invite our supporters to help us celebrate the Celtic Moon of the Horses with an Irish pub fundraiser. Since that is not possible this year due to Covid-19 we are asking everyone to help us celebrate from afar. Covid-19 has not reduced our need to care for abused and neglected horses, in fact we have never cared for as many horses as we are in 2020!

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 19131 San Diego, CA 92159 United States

title.narrative: Help Betty sustain Gatoto students through COVID!

description.narrative: For 25 years, Betty has run the successful Gatoto School that feeds and educates 1,000 students in Mukuru kwa Reuben, Nairobi. She used ingenuity and leadership to start it at the request of community leaders. Despite government promises, there is no free education within this slum - a crowded settlement where families often also lack food, electricity, water, and sanitation. COVID further disrupted school, livelihoods, and was a risk multiplier. As schools and meals stop, children go hungry.

mailing-address.narrative: 4320 Tuckerman Street University Park, MD 20782 United States

title.narrative: Support youth in four communities in Timor-Leste

description.narrative: Funding will support early intervention and prevention activities, case work services and an education re-engagement program to up to 200 at-risk youth in four marginalised communities in Dili, Timor-Leste. There are high rates of educational disengagement, domestic violence and gang membership amongst youth in Dili, and the COVID-19 pandemic has marginalised them further. Supporting young people to access support services, and re-engaging them in education will be critical to their future.

organisation.narrative: Youth Off The Streets - Overseas Relief Fund Limited

mailing-address.narrative: 28 Bowden St Alexandria Sydney 2015 Australia

title.narrative: Restore lives of 300 households in Kasese Uganda

description.narrative: In Kasese District, and the Rwenzori region of Uganda, hundreds of vulnerable children and women are living in camps with no food, clean water, shelter and hygiene facilities after losing everything they had to floods. Joy for Children Uganda (JFCU) is working to restore their lives. By donating to this cause, you will not only impact on the lives of 100,000 children, women and men affected by floods and at risk of being abused but also prevent the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic.

mailing-address.narrative: P.O Box 15383, Clock Tower Kampala, Uganda 256 Uganda

title.narrative: Covid-19: Food for street children in Mumbai

description.narrative: The project provides water, food and basic necessities to the street children and their families in Bombay. The entire population of the city is confined due to the Covid-19 pandemic, and more of 40,000 children live in the streets while their families are unable to work to meet their essential needs. In the current situation, they are more threatened by hunger than by the virus. We intend to reach at least 3,600 children and their families with food and hygienic products.

mailing-address.narrative: C. Pelai 32, 2 Barcelona 08001 Spain

title.narrative: A turn to learn-educate a deaf child in Zimbabwe

description.narrative: What does going to school mean to a deaf child in Zimbabwe? It means acceptance in the family and a chance to learn sign language. This project will reduce the burden of school fees for 50 families of deaf children, and support recovery from the economic effects of Covid-19 lockdown. It will give children continued learning at home and enable them to immediately get back into school when they reopen. Your contributions cover fees and learner packs; parent business training and start up kits.

mailing-address.narrative: Box 3396 Paulington Mutare, MANICALAND zzzzzz Zimbabwe

title.narrative: Food Gardens for Hungry South African Families

description.narrative: South Africa is plagued by poverty, hunger and unemployment, following the recent global economic crisis, steep food and fuel prices and severe climate events. Combined with the COVID-19 pandemic, the need for local food production is urgent. INMED South Africa's SEEDS FOR LIFE campaign will help 2,500 households plant home gardens. Your donation will provide free seeds and training to families on the brink of starvation, with future assistance to ensure the gardens and families thrive.

mailing-address.narrative: 21630 Ridgetop Circle, Suite 130 Sterling, VA 20166 United States

title.narrative: Feed 200 families in the Dominican Republic

description.narrative: In the Dominican Republic there is a high index of extreme poverty, which affects children the most, our foundation seeks to impact 200 families of extreme poverty in vulnerable areas of the country, benefiting them with non-perishable food during the COVID-19 pandemic. In this way we are able to feed 800 children in situations of poverty, abandonment, hunger and education in the Dominican Republic.

mailing-address.narrative: calle club rotario no. 46 Santo Domingo 11501 Dominican Republic

title.narrative: SAVE 100 VULNERABLE HOUSEHOLDS FROM COVID-19 GHANA

description.narrative: CEWEFIA is seeking support for 100 Vulnerable and marginalized women fish processors and their children who are finding it extremely difficult to afford face masks, soap, tissue paper and hand sanitizers in this COVID- 19 period. This is as a result of seasonal nature of the fish business, dwindling fish stock and big family sizes. The little fish they get at the landing beaches to buy is very expensive which makes life unbearable for them.

mailing-address.narrative: B342 Bronyibima Estates, Elmina, Komenda-Edina-Eguafo-Abrem Municipality P. O. Box EL 25 Elmina Ghana

title.narrative: Bring Life Saving Healthcare to 1000+ Dominicans

description.narrative: What would your life be like if you did not have regular access to healthcare? How would you feel if you did not have access to healthcare during COVID-19? For residents in the mountains of Puerto Plata and Santiago Provinces, this is a consistent reality. Our project will deliver access to necessary medication for over 1,000 patients in 19 rural, underserved communities in the Dominican Republic.

organisation.narrative: Partners for Rural Health in the Dominican Republic

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 1742 Portland, ME 04104 United States

title.narrative: Arousyag Campaign to Support Women & LGBT People

description.narrative: The Arousyag campaign, a brainchild of a few UK-based individuals, unites two human rights charities, the Women's Resource Center (WRC) & Pink Armenia (Pink), who are pioneers in supporting the rights of women, young girls and LGBT citizens in Armenia. The outbreak of the COVID-19 pandemic has created unprecedented difficulties for these marginalised groups, isolating and depriving them of the crucial social, psychological, legal and medical support offered by these two respected NGOs.

mailing-address.narrative: Hovsep Emin 119/2 Yerevan, Yerevan 0012 Armenia

title.narrative: Safe, Clean Water for Families in Rural Honduras

description.narrative: Clean water is particularly important right now during the Global Covid-19 pandemic. We have all become more aware of the need for clean hands and hygienic spaces. Mayor Potencial is a volunteer-run not-for-profit organization, 501(c)(3), working with the community of El Rodeito in Honduras to provide food, education, and safe drinkable water. This project will supply the village with a water filtration, storage, and a delivery system.

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 102 Marathon, NY 13803 United States

title.narrative: Post-COVID Career Training for African Students

description.narrative: The Ashinaga Africa Initiative supports talented orphaned students to enroll at top global universities. They are committed to returning to the African continent post-graduation to contribute to its development. To do so, we provide them with career training, including access to a quality internship on the continent. Due to the recent pandemic, internships abroad have been cancelled. We are offering online solutions to deliver the high-quality training scholars need to succeed in their careers.

mailing-address.narrative: Sabokaikan 4F 2-7-5 Hirakawacho Chiyoda-ku 102-8639 Japan

title.narrative: Educate children of communities in wildlife areas

description.narrative: This project will provide individual desks for school going children from families living within wildlife areas of the Tsavo ecosystem and create a water and sanitation facility for the school community in Jira Primary, Kenya. Clean water and soap is critical for prevention of covid-19 among all communities particularly the vulnerable population of children from remote areas who attend under-resourced schools and are expected to return to school in September,2020.

title.narrative: Covid19 relief support to 5000 people in Malawi

description.narrative: This project will educate and support Malawian people in city of Lilongwe and in rural communities about Covid 19; recognising the symptoms of the virus, how to reduce the risk of getting the virus and what should be done if they catch the virus. It will provide information, education and resources to support vulnerable people in a country with very compromised facilities in how to manage the virus.

mailing-address.narrative: P.o Box X191 Lilongwe X191 Malawi

title.narrative: COVID-19 Response for 103185 People in Nepal.

description.narrative: The proposed intervention is aimed at distributing 3,300 Rapid Diagnostic Test (RDT) kits,5,000 sanitizers and 5,000 masks in four rural municipalities of Nuwakot district of Nepal. The potential beneficiates/recipients of RDT are persons who have come from abroad, health worker,labor and corona infection . The NGO will mobilize its youths who are trained in social mobilization and leadership issues and are preassembly involved in distributing relief packages at adjoining district (Kathmandu).

title.narrative: Empowering 500 women in Yemen facing COVID-19

description.narrative: Yemen is a place for civil war. Women & Children are the most affected by the six years' war.With COVID-19 pandemic impact which effected (the already destroyed economic) and caused closing works, the situation gets worse for families headed by Women. Concern Org. providing feeding and health support for vulnerable women and their children.Women and children in Yemen are facing risks in their lives and our work ensure their survival,well-being,empower women and inspiring effective solutions.

title.narrative: Covid Can't Win! Help Support Survivors & Families

description.narrative: Trapped! Our Modern Day Prison! COVID-19 has destroyed countless lives globally & thrust millions into poverty & needless suffering. The Masses have lost their zeal for life & hope for tomorrow! The Covid Can't Project & iNYLAC reminds us Daily that Together, We're Stronger Than any Obstacle! Working Together we provide Masks, Food, Supplies, Support & Encouragement in the USA to those hardest hit! Proving that Social Distancing is Not Social Isolation! We Are in this Together & We Will Win!

organisation.narrative: True Help & Empowerment for Women & Aspiring Youth Foundation USA

title.narrative: Access to 2.500 menstrual cups for girls and women

description.narrative: The project will deliver 2.500 menstrual cups to girls, women of Afro- Colombian women, migrants and adolescents in vulnerable conditions in Colombia. We want to relieve them of the economic burdens caused by having to take care of their menstrual hygiene care during the COVID-19 pandemic and to contribute to their autonomy, offering a more sustainable method. We would like also to help dispel myths and taboos about menstruation.

mailing-address.narrative: Carrera 17 # 33-50 Bogota, Cundinamarca 110311 Colombia

title.narrative: Empowering poor to fight COVID-19 in South Sudan

description.narrative: Charity and Empowerment Foundation (CEF) support poor families in South Sudan to fight COVID-19 by distributing soaps and handwashing facilities. Through the distribution of soaps and handwashing facilities, we are helping 1200 households to protect themselves from COVID-19.

mailing-address.narrative: Baping License Center Juba Town Market Juba 93 South Sudan

title.narrative: Keep at-risk children dancing and fed in Kenya

description.narrative: School closure due to COVID presents an unprecedented risk to children's education, protection and well-being. ChezaCheza will give 200+ children in Kibera (Africa's largest urban slum) dance & life skills classes, a warm meal and food packages to feed their family. We are a non-profit that provides at-risk children with quality life skills education through dance in safe spaces through local mentors. Let's keep the families in our community safe, healthy and dancing during this crisis!

mailing-address.narrative: Maple Court H4 Galana Road Nairobi 22917-00505 Kenya

title.narrative: Support food aid to 3000 refugees in Cameroon

description.narrative: Key Farmers Cameroon plans to build a modern cassava production, processing and transformation Centre in Kumba and help provide free vocational training to 10 women groups (300 female headed households) who hail from impoverished communities so they can follow up a food distributing project and also provide free meals to 3000 refugees, orphans, covid-19 victims and internally displaced persons (IDPs) traumatized by the anglophone crisis.
